result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
8:34 AM  Not called on the record.  No attorney has been appointed as of today.  
Court appoints Atty Marchan in this matter and new date to be set.
Hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Order on petition for appointment of an attorney.
**Clerk inboxed to BC on 11-04-2022.**

2:47 PM Defendant Donta L Green in court, in custody.  Attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Court reports defendant has not yet completed the evaluation for the public defender as of today. 
Court informs defendant of his right to counsel in this matter. 
Court will appoint a court appointed attorney at this time.  
Court will not order a repayment at this time, the appointment will be for purpose of getting thru the competency issue. 
Court will address repayment at a later date.
Hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status hearing on October 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

filed by Dr. Deborah Collins
**DUPLICATE FILING.**
Review hearing on October 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Competency Sent to CC Herring for signature
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with Ascension Elm Brook Hospital (unless for emergency medical services) listed in the Criminal Complaint.

1:04 PM Defendant Donta L Green in court, in custody. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.  Court reads Criminal Complaint to the defendant on the record.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.   Court requests the Public Defender representative in court to add this defendant to the list to be evaluated.  COURT ORDERS COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2).  Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days.
Review hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
